titleStmt.title: The sermon, which Christ made on the way to Emaus to those two sorowfull disciples, set downe in a dialogue by D. Vrbane Regius, wherein he hath gathered and expounded the chiefe prophecies of the old Testament concerning Christ
Dialogus von der schönen predigt die Christus Luc. 24. von Jerusalem bis gen Emaus den zweien jüngeren am Ostertag, aus Mose und allen prophete gethan hat. English
titleStmt.author: Rhegius, Urbanus, 1489-1541.

titleStmt.title: The sermon, which Christ made on the way to Emaus to those two sorowfull disciples, set downe in a dialogue by D. Vrbane Regius, wherein he hath gathered and expounded the chiefe prophecies of the old Testament concerning Christ
Dialogus von der schönen predigt die Christus Luc. 24. von Jerusalem bis gen Emaus den zweien jüngeren am Ostertag, aus Mose und allen prophete gethan hat. English
titleStmt.author: Rhegius, Urbanus, 1489-1541.
Hilton, W. (William), fl. 1578.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Daye dwelling ouer Aldersgate and are to be sould at his long shop at the west dore of Paules,

notesStmt.note: A translation of a Latin translation of: Dialogus von der schönen predigt die Christus Luc. 24. von Jerusalem bis gen Emaus den zweien jüngeren am Ostertag, aus Mose und allen prophete gethan hat.
At foot of title: Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis.
Running title reads: Christes sermon, going to Emaus.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
